metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5015 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
bozotic HTTP server (aka bozohttpd) before 20140708, as used in NetBSD, truncates paths when checking .htpasswd restrictions, which allows remote attackers to bypass the HTTP authentication scheme and access restrictions via a long path.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5015` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bozohttpd - 20111118-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bozohttpd package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20111118-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
